title: Network Security Engineer
descriptionText:
AlgoQuant Asset Management - Network Security EngineerLocation: Fully Remote (Preference for London, New York, or Dubai)Reporting to: Head of TechOps
About AlgoQuant Asset Management
At AlgoQuant, we're building the future of digital asset management; grounded in rigorous research, world-class technology and a relentless focus on performance.
We began as a proprietary trading firm, developing sophisticated algorithmic strategies and operating in some of the most complex and fast-moving markets. That DNA remains at our core, but today we are evolving into a fully remote, globally distributed Investment Management business. This transformation reflects a broader ambition: to scale our edge, deliver institutional-grade results, and set new standards for the industry.
Our quantitative environment is built to empower innovation, combining vast data capabilities, disciplined model development, and highly automated execution. Risk is embedded in every layer of our thinking, with robust measurement, control, and scenario analysis integrated into our systems and decision-making. Technology is not just a tool for us, it’s a core competency and a competitive advantage.
Role Overview
Network Security Engineer – TechOpsWe’re looking for a Network Security Engineer to help strengthen and secure our cloud-native infrastructure at the core of AlgoQuant’s research and trading systems. This is a hands-on role focused on securing high-performance environments built on AWS and Kubernetes, where reliability, automation, and security are critical.
You’ll work closely with engineering, operations, and compliance to design and maintain systems that are secure by design—automated, auditable, and built for scale.We especially value senior candidates who bring deep expertise in cybersecurity but are also comfortable operating across the broader TechOps landscape. If you’re someone who can both spot vulnerabilities and build resilient infrastructure, we’d love to talk.
What we’re looking for:
Strong technical skills and sound judgment in fast-moving environments.Experience in/with ZTA, CI/CD pipelines, Infra as Code, AWS, Scripting, Intrusion Detection and Prevention methods and related toolingA hands-on builder with a bias toward automation and a deep respect for simplicity.Someone who thrives in low-ego, high-ownership teams whilst advocating sound security practices across the firm.Openness to working across the tech stack—not just security tools, but core systems and infrastructure.
We don’t expect you to tick every box. What matters most is your ability to think clearly, act responsibly, and build systems that work.
What Success Looks Like:
Core infrastructure is secured with well-defined controls, monitored continuously, and aligned with best practices for high-performance, cloud-native environmentsSecurity tooling and workflows are automated, auditable, and integrated into CI/CD and infrastructure pipelines without slowing down development velocityIncident detection and response processes are reliable, rehearsed, and capable of identifying and containing threats quicklySecrets management and role-based access controls are robust, scalable, and consistently enforced across environmentsYou’re a trusted partner to DevOps, engineering, and compliance - able to balance risk reduction with operational efficiencyYou help shape a security-first mindset across the team by contributing to internal standards, tooling, and knowledge sharingYou’ve improved the signal-to-noise ratio in our monitoring and alerting systems, enabling faster and more confident response to anomaliesYou’ve made measurable improvements to security posture without adding unnecessary complexity or overhead
Why Join AlgoQuant?
Remote first environmentWork at the forefront of quantitative trading and AI-driven research in crypto markets.Collaborate with world-class researchers, traders, and engineers to drive technological excellence.Competitive compensation, including performance-based incentives and long-term upside potential.
descriptionHtml:
AlgoQuant Asset Management - Network Security Engineer

Location: Fully Remote (Preference for London, New York, or Dubai)

Reporting to: Head of TechOps


About AlgoQuant Asset Management


At AlgoQuant, we're building the future of digital asset management; grounded in rigorous research, world-class technology and a relentless focus on performance.


We began as a proprietary trading firm, developing sophisticated algorithmic strategies and operating in some of the most complex and fast-moving markets. That DNA remains at our core, but today we are evolving into a fully remote, globally distributed Investment Management business. This transformation reflects a broader ambition: to scale our edge, deliver institutional-grade results, and set new standards for the industry.


Our quantitative environment is built to empower innovation, combining vast data capabilities, disciplined model development, and highly automated execution. Risk is embedded in every layer of our thinking, with robust measurement, control, and scenario analysis integrated into our systems and decision-making. Technology is not just a tool for us, it’s a core competency and a competitive advantage.


Role Overview


Network Security Engineer – TechOps

We’re looking for a Network Security Engineer to help strengthen and secure our cloud-native infrastructure at the core of AlgoQuant’s research and trading systems. This is a hands-on role focused on securing high-performance environments built on AWS and Kubernetes, where reliability, automation, and security are critical.


You’ll work closely with engineering, operations, and compliance to design and maintain systems that are secure by design—automated, auditable, and built for scale.

We especially value senior candidates who bring deep expertise in cybersecurity but are also comfortable operating across the broader TechOps landscape. If you’re someone who can both spot vulnerabilities and build resilient infrastructure, we’d love to talk.


What we’re looking for:


  • Strong technical skills and sound judgment in fast-moving environments.
  • Experience in/with ZTA, CI/CD pipelines, Infra as Code, AWS, Scripting, Intrusion Detection and Prevention methods and related tooling
  • A hands-on builder with a bias toward automation and a deep respect for simplicity.
  • Someone who thrives in low-ego, high-ownership teams whilst advocating sound security practices across the firm.
  • Openness to working across the tech stack—not just security tools, but core systems and infrastructure.

We don’t expect you to tick every box. What matters most is your ability to think clearly, act responsibly, and build systems that work.


What Success Looks Like:


  • Core infrastructure is secured with well-defined controls, monitored continuously, and aligned with best practices for high-performance, cloud-native environments
  • Security tooling and workflows are automated, auditable, and integrated into CI/CD and infrastructure pipelines without slowing down development velocity
  • Incident detection and response processes are reliable, rehearsed, and capable of identifying and containing threats quickly
  • Secrets management and role-based access controls are robust, scalable, and consistently enforced across environments
  • You’re a trusted partner to DevOps, engineering, and compliance - able to balance risk reduction with operational efficiency
  • You help shape a security-first mindset across the team by contributing to internal standards, tooling, and knowledge sharing
  • You’ve improved the signal-to-noise ratio in our monitoring and alerting systems, enabling faster and more confident response to anomalies
  • You’ve made measurable improvements to security posture without adding unnecessary complexity or overhead

Why Join AlgoQuant?


  • Remote first environment
  • Work at the forefront of quantitative trading and AI-driven research in crypto markets.
  • Collaborate with world-class researchers, traders, and engineers to drive technological excellence.
  • Competitive compensation, including performance-based incentives and long-term upside potential.

title: Quality Assurance Developer, Trilogy (Remote) - $60,000/year USD
descriptionText:
Ready to revolutionize quality assurance with artificial intelligence? We're not looking for traditional QA engineers who follow the same old playbook. We need a visionary who can transform testing through the power of AI. In this role, you'll architect next-generation test frameworks that learn, adapt, and anticipate issues before they become problems.

Forget being the last stop before deployment—our QA team operates at the heart of product development. You'll pioneer GenAI solutions that automatically generate comprehensive test scenarios from product requirements, simulate unpredictable user behaviors, and uncover hidden edge cases that traditional testing would miss.

This position demands someone who thrives on innovation and technical challenges. You'll build sophisticated systems that leverage AI to predict failure points, analyze patterns across thousands of tests, and deliver actionable quality insights in real-time. This isn't about following a QA checklist—it's about engineering intelligence into the very fabric of our quality process.

Join our forward-thinking, AI-powered product team where your technical expertise will directly shape user experiences. If you're ready to redefine what's possible in quality assurance and harness cutting-edge AI to do it, we want to hear from you!

What You Will Be Doing

Design and deploy sophisticated AI-powered test automation frameworks that scale with our rapidly evolving productsLeverage GenAI technologies to extract meaningful patterns from test results, identifying subtle defect trends before they impact usersCreate intelligent simulation systems that use AI to generate diverse user scenarios and stress conditions, uncovering vulnerabilities traditional testing would miss

Quality Assurance Developer Key Responsibilities

Safeguard product quality through advanced AI-driven automation, continuous quality monitoring, and proactive issue detection to ensure flawless releases

Basic Requirements

Minimum 4 years of progressive experience in quality assurance engineering with demonstrated expertise in designing and implementing automated testing frameworksPractical experience implementing or developing with generative AI tools in either development or quality assurance contexts

About Trilogy

Hundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.

There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!

Working with us

This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover as a Contractor of Record. The compensation level for this role is $30 USD/hour, which equates to $60,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.

Crossover Job Code: LJ-5603-AE-COUNTRY-QualityAssuran.003

title: DevOps Architect, Trilogy (Remote) - $100,000/year USD
descriptionText:
Are you a DevOps engineer who sees challenges as opportunities and thrives in high-pressure environments? If so, we have the perfect role for you. As a DevOps and AWS infrastructure expert, your mission will be to transform disorganized legacy systems into a streamlined, efficient AWS architecture with over 99.9% uptime. You will tackle a diverse range of acquired products, each with unique characteristics, migrating and optimizing them within a cohesive AWS framework. Your work will focus on creating robust monitoring and automation systems to minimize incidents.

Unlike typical roles where you manage a single stack, this position demands the consolidation and optimization of multiple stacks, focusing on strategic database consolidation to enhance cost-effectiveness and management across our portfolio. This is not a maintenance role; it's a chance to redesign fragmented environments into seamless, high-performing systems.

From infrastructure migrations to AI-driven automation, you will have the freedom to make impactful infrastructure decisions, planning and executing cloud migrations with minimal downtime and automating processes using AI/ML-powered workflows. This role is ideal for independent problem-solvers who excel at organizing complex systems into efficient operations. If you seek a dynamic environment where you can own and optimize high-impact infrastructure projects, we want you to join us!

What You Will Be Doing

Orchestrating intricate infrastructure transformations, including migrating legacy systems to AWS cloud and executing lift-and-shift migrationsCrafting and deploying monitoring strategies and building automations for operational workflows and software deploymentsEngaging in system monitoring, performing backups, responding to incidents, migrating and configuring databases, and optimizing costs

What You Won’t Be Doing

Spending excessive time in Jira and status meetings—we prioritize action over endless discussionsPreserving outdated systems indefinitely—you will drive impactful improvementsWaiting for bureaucratic approvals—you'll have the autonomy to implement immediate fixesBeing confined to narrow technical silos—this role demands both broad and deep technical expertiseStruggling to secure budget for essential improvements—we recognize the value of infrastructure investment

DevOps Architect Key Responsibilities

Enhance cloud infrastructure reliability and standardization across our product portfolio by implementing advanced monitoring, automation, and AWS best practices.

Basic Requirements

Extensive AWS infrastructure expertise (our primary platform; experience with other clouds alone is insufficient)Proficiency in programming with Python or JavaScript for automation and toolingExperience managing and migrating production databases with various engines (MySql, Postgres, Oracle, MS-SQL)Advanced skills in Docker/KubernetesExpertise in infrastructure automation tools (Terraform, Ansible, or CloudFormation)Proficiency in Linux systems administration

About Trilogy

Hundreds of software businesses run on the Trilogy Business Platform. For three decades, Trilogy has been known for 3 things: Relentlessly seeking top talent, Innovating new technology, and incubating new businesses. Our technological innovation is spearheaded by a passion for simple customer-facing designs. Our incubation of new businesses ranges from entirely new moon-shot ideas to rearchitecting existing projects for today's modern cloud-based stack. Trilogy is a place where you can be surrounded with great people, be proud of doing great work, and grow your career by leaps and bounds.

There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!

Working with us

This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover as a Contractor of Record. The compensation level for this role is $50 USD/hour, which equates to $100,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.

title: Senior Full Stack Engineer (Angular + Python)
descriptionText:
✨ Where do we hire from? Find out more about hiring at TestGorilla
Hi there, I'm Erica, Senior Engineering Manager at TestGorilla. We’re excited to share more about the Senior Full Stack Engineer role and our team.
About TestGorillaImagine a world where everyone lands their dream job. TestGorilla is revolutionizing the hiring process through skills-based hiring, empowering one billion people to do just that. What you’ll bringUphold TestGorilla's behaviors and foster an inclusive, supportive culture.Collaborate effectively with global colleagues across teams and time zones.You have strong full stack experience delivering production-ready applications with modern backend and frontend technologiesStrong experience with Django as part of your Python toolkit; you’ve built, deployed, and maintained production-grade web applications using this framework.You aim for excellence—pixel-perfect UI, high-quality code, and lightning-fast load timesYou have experience designing, implementing, running, and maintaining scalable backend services, including REST APIs and event-driven architecturesYou ensure code quality by writing unit, integration, and end-to-end testsYou participate in code reviews, contribute to architecture discussions, and mentor other team members through knowledge sharing and guidanceYou’re fluent with relational and NoSQL databases and understand cloud infrastructure, monitoring, and deployment practicesYou have a solid understanding of UX/UI design, usability, and accessibilityYou highly value building a world-class engineering team and helping others growYou’re motivated by about continuously improving your skills and learning new technologiesYou enjoy influencing others and promote technical excellence while staying open to changeYou’re resilient in ambiguous situations and approach challenges from multiple perspectivesYou have strong written and verbal communication skills—you validate your decisions and explain them clearly
We typically expect candidates with 5+ years of engineering experience, and at least 3–5 years of Angular and Python experience, to have the skills aboveWe actively seek diversity and encourage applications from everyone. descriptionHtml:
✨ Where do we hire from? Find out more about hiring at TestGorilla


Hi there, I'm Erica, Senior Engineering Manager at TestGorilla. We’re excited to share more about the Senior Full Stack Engineer role and our team.


About TestGorilla

Imagine a world where everyone lands their dream job. TestGorilla is revolutionizing the hiring process through skills-based hiring, empowering one billion people to do just that. Our platform provides scientifically validated tests, enabling companies to hire faster and without bias, based on true skills and potential. We also empower candidates to showcase their abilities and find ideal roles.

At TestGorilla, we stand for diversity, act with integrity, and put talent first. We celebrate individuality and creativity and believe in a workplace where you can make a big impact. Our team works in a flexible, autonomous environment with a focus on well-being and results.

Join us in creating a future where skills matter most, and everyone has the chance to land their dream job.


About the role

As our Senior Full Stack Engineer, you'll be essential in achieving TestGorilla's vision of helping one billion people land their dream job. You'll lead the design and development of scalable, user-friendly features that empower candidates and hiring teams alike. This isn't just a role; it's your chance to make a real difference by shaping a product that levels the playing field for talent around the world. You’ll directly contribute to delivering a reliable, high-quality platform that helps companies make fair, skills-based hiring decisions at scale. Join our driven, remote-first team, and let’s achieve these ambitious goals together.

Want to see what it's like to join the Engineering team and make an impact as a Senior Full Stack Engineer? Get an inside look in this quick video


Responsibilities

In this role, your responsibilities will include but not limited to:

  • Own features end-to-end across the stack - from building robust backend services to crafting delightful user experiences
  • Design and implement highly scalable and reliable architectures using modern technologies (e.g., Python, Django, Angular, AWS)
  • Lead the full software development lifecycle - from ideation to deployment and everything in between
  • Write clean, well-tested, maintainable code across backend and frontend systems
  • Collaborate closely with product managers, designers, and other engineers to build intuitive and impactful user experiences
  • Optimize both backend and frontend performance for speed, scalability, and reliability
  • Mentor and support less-experienced engineers through technical guidance and leadership
  • Contribute to and improve DevOps pipelines, ensuring efficient and secure deployments
  • Foster a culture of technical excellence, continuous improvement, and knowledge sharing across disciplines

What you’ll bring

  • Uphold TestGorilla's behaviors and foster an inclusive, supportive culture.
  • Collaborate effectively with global colleagues across teams and time zones.
  • You have strong full stack experience delivering production-ready applications with modern backend and frontend technologies
  • Strong experience with Django as part of your Python toolkit; you’ve built, deployed, and maintained production-grade web applications using this framework.
  • You aim for excellence—pixel-perfect UI, high-quality code, and lightning-fast load times
  • You have experience designing, implementing, running, and maintaining scalable backend services, including REST APIs and event-driven architectures
  • You ensure code quality by writing unit, integration, and end-to-end tests
  • You participate in code reviews, contribute to architecture discussions, and mentor other team members through knowledge sharing and guidance
  • You’re fluent with relational and NoSQL databases and understand cloud infrastructure, monitoring, and deployment practices
  • You have a solid understanding of UX/UI design, usability, and accessibility
  • You highly value building a world-class engineering team and helping others grow
  • You’re motivated by about continuously improving your skills and learning new technologies
  • You enjoy influencing others and promote technical excellence while staying open to change
  • You’re resilient in ambiguous situations and approach challenges from multiple perspectives
  • You have strong written and verbal communication skills—you validate your decisions and explain them clearly

We typically expect candidates with 5+ years of engineering experience, and at least 3–5 years of Angular and Python experience, to have the skills above

We actively seek diversity and encourage applications from everyone. If you're interested in this role but your experience doesn't perfectly match the description, please still apply. Studies show that women and underrepresented groups can be hesitant to apply unless they meet every requirement. If this role excites you and you're confident you can do the job, we encourage you to apply!


Bonus skills

  • You’ve worked in a SaaS product-based company
  • You are experienced with Agile methodologies such as Scrum, or Kanban
  • You have hands-on experience with DevOps, containerization, CI/CD (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes, GitHub Actions)

What’s in it for you?

Please note: Some specifics, particularly around leave, may vary depending on your country of residence. This will be discussed during the hiring process.

  • Global Team: Join a fully remote, mission-driven team from around the world
  • Competitive compensation: Receive a competitive pay € 50,000 - € 80,000 + Share Appreciation Rights (SARs)
  • Remote & flexible work: Work from almost anywhere*. Enjoy flexible hours and asynchronous work to balance work and life.
  • * Check out the Countries we currently hire from here
  • Remote work budget: €1,000 per year to help you set up your home office
  • Growth & development: Invest in yourself and your career with a 3.5% L&D budget and clear growth opportunities
  • Stimulating work environment: Tackle new challenges and work with innovative technology in a dynamic setting
  • Connect with your team: Join optional fun virtual socials, AMAs with team members and leadership, and regular fun chats. Build a strong sense of community!
  • TestGorilla community groups: Join peers to build community and boost opportunities for connection, advocacy, and professional development.
  • Parent/Caregiver support: We provide a caregiver-friendly work environment with paid 8-16 week parental leave and tailored return-to-work approaches
  • Work-life balance: Our unlimited and flexible time off policy empowers you to take the time you need to recharge and maintain your well-being

Interested?

We believe in using our own product to ensure fair and objective hiring. If this role aligns with your skills and aspirations, we invite you to complete one of our very own assessments. This will give you a firsthand experience of our platform and help us get to know you better. We look forward to hearing from you!

TestGorilla is committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace. We believe that diverse teams are stronger teams, and we encourage applications from people of all backgrounds. We understand that some candidates may experience test anxiety, and we want to assure you that accommodations are available and can be requested prior to sitting our assessments. Your request will not negatively impact your application, as we do not factor this into our review process.

company.name: TestGorilla
company.description:
TestGorilla works. CVs don’t. We’re placing people in dream jobs with talent assessments that identify the best candidates at the start of the recruitment process. 
With TestGorilla, our customers save valuable time, make hiring decisions objectively, and avoid expensive mishires.

Our affordable tests replace subjective, incomplete, and often inflated resumes with objective, reliable, and fair results that measure aptitude, practical job skills, culture add, and motivation. Our wide-ranging, scientifically supported assessments help recruiters and HR managers to hire top talent faster, easier, and bias-free.

title: Speech Coach - AI Tutor
descriptionText:
Job Title: Voice Expert - AI Trainer
Job Type: Part-Time or Full-time
Location: Remote
Job Summary:Join our customer's team as a Voice Expert - AI Trainer, where your specialized knowledge in voice production, speech coaching, or voiceover artistry will help shape the future of AI voice technology. In this dynamic role, you will leverage your acute listening skills and extensive voice-related vocabulary to provide invaluable training and feedback, playing a pivotal role in elevating AI-generated voice output.
Key Responsibilities:• Analyze and evaluate AI-generated voice samples for accuracy, naturalness, and expressiveness.• Provide detailed verbal and written feedback, utilizing industry terminology to describe nuances in vocal performance.• Collaborate with AI engineers and linguists to refine voice algorithms and enhance model performance.• Develop comprehensive evaluation criteria for voice characteristics such as tone, pitch, pacing, and clarity.• Coach and instruct AI systems on a wide range of vocal styles, emotional deliveries, and accents.• Document findings, track improvements, and suggest actionable insights for ongoing model training.• Participate in regular virtual meetings to align project goals and share expertise.
Required Skills and Qualifications:• Demonstrated expertise as a voice producer, speech coach, or professional voiceover artist.• Exceptional written and verbal communication skills with a focus on clarity and precision.• Advanced ability to discern and articulate subtle differences in vocal expression.• Experience instructing or coaching others in vocal performance or technique.• Strong attention to detail and commitment to high-quality deliverables.• Comfort working independently in a remote, part-time capacity.• Sound understanding of audio production principles and voice recording technology.
Preferred Qualifications:• Previous experience collaborating on AI or machine learning projects.• Familiarity with phonetics, linguistics, or relevant academic background.• Track record of delivering constructive critique in creative or technical environments.
As a valued member of our customer's team, your insights will directly influence AI voice systems used by millions. We welcome voice producers, speech coaches, and accomplished voiceover professionals who are passionate about guiding and elevating vocal talent — not just performing, but shaping the standard for next-generation voice experiences.
descriptionHtml:
Job Title: Voice Expert - AI Trainer


Job Type: Part-Time or Full-time


Location: Remote


Job Summary:

Join our customer's team as a Voice Expert - AI Trainer, where your specialized knowledge in voice production, speech coaching, or voiceover artistry will help shape the future of AI voice technology. In this dynamic role, you will leverage your acute listening skills and extensive voice-related vocabulary to provide invaluable training and feedback, playing a pivotal role in elevating AI-generated voice output.


Key Responsibilities:

• Analyze and evaluate AI-generated voice samples for accuracy, naturalness, and expressiveness.

• Provide detailed verbal and written feedback, utilizing industry terminology to describe nuances in vocal performance.

• Collaborate with AI engineers and linguists to refine voice algorithms and enhance model performance.

• Develop comprehensive evaluation criteria for voice characteristics such as tone, pitch, pacing, and clarity.

• Coach and instruct AI systems on a wide range of vocal styles, emotional deliveries, and accents.

• Document findings, track improvements, and suggest actionable insights for ongoing model training.

• Participate in regular virtual meetings to align project goals and share expertise.


Required Skills and Qualifications:

• Demonstrated expertise as a voice producer, speech coach, or professional voiceover artist.

• Exceptional written and verbal communication skills with a focus on clarity and precision.

• Advanced ability to discern and articulate subtle differences in vocal expression.

• Experience instructing or coaching others in vocal performance or technique.

• Strong attention to detail and commitment to high-quality deliverables.

• Comfort working independently in a remote, part-time capacity.

• Sound understanding of audio production principles and voice recording technology.


Preferred Qualifications:

• Previous experience collaborating on AI or machine learning projects.

• Familiarity with phonetics, linguistics, or relevant academic background.

• Track record of delivering constructive critique in creative or technical environments.


As a valued member of our customer's team, your insights will directly influence AI voice systems used by millions. We welcome voice producers, speech coaches, and accomplished voiceover professionals who are passionate about guiding and elevating vocal talent — not just performing, but shaping the standard for next-generation voice experiences.

title: Pharmacist - AI Trainer
descriptionText:
Job Type: Part-time
Location: Remote
Job Summary:Join our customer’s team as a Pharmacist - AI Trainer and play a pivotal role in shaping the accuracy and reliability of AI-powered medical platforms. Leverage your clinical expertise to review, train, and enhance artificial intelligence in delivering high-quality, medically-sound information for healthcare providers and patients.
Key Responsibilities:Analyze and review AI-generated content related to prescriptions, drug interactions, and patient education for medical accuracy and clarity.Offer expert feedback to optimize AI responses aligned with current pharmaceutical standards and patient safety protocols.Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams to design training sets based on real-world pharmacy scenarios and best practices.Advise on medication selection, proper dosage, contraindications, and emerging pharmaceutical therapies to ensure comprehensive AI solutions.Contribute to continuous improvement by identifying gaps in AI knowledge and suggesting targeted educational content.Ensure all AI outputs adhere strictly to regulatory, ethical, and privacy guidelines in pharmacy practice.Communicate complex pharmacy concepts clearly through both written reports and virtual team discussions.
Required Skills and Qualifications:Active pharmacist license in good standing with substantial experience in drug dispensing and patient counseling.Thorough understanding of drug interactions, contraindications, side effects, and evidence-based medication use.Demonstrated excellence in both written and verbal communication, with a strong attention to detail.Experience advising physicians and collaborating with multidisciplinary medical teams.Keen interest in medical technology, clinical decision support, and AI solutions in healthcare.High standards for accuracy, ethics, and patient safety in all professional undertakings.Self-motivated, reliable, and comfortable working independently in a remote, part-time setting.
Preferred Qualifications:Prior experience in AI training, healthcare informatics, or pharmacy-related software development.Advanced degree or certifications in clinical pharmacy, informatics, or a related field.Familiarity with regulatory requirements governing digital health and data privacy.
descriptionHtml:
Job Type: Part-time


Location: Remote


Job Summary:

Join our customer’s team as a Pharmacist - AI Trainer and play a pivotal role in shaping the accuracy and reliability of AI-powered medical platforms. Leverage your clinical expertise to review, train, and enhance artificial intelligence in delivering high-quality, medically-sound information for healthcare providers and patients.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Analyze and review AI-generated content related to prescriptions, drug interactions, and patient education for medical accuracy and clarity.
  • Offer expert feedback to optimize AI responses aligned with current pharmaceutical standards and patient safety protocols.
  • Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams to design training sets based on real-world pharmacy scenarios and best practices.
  • Advise on medication selection, proper dosage, contraindications, and emerging pharmaceutical therapies to ensure comprehensive AI solutions.
  • Contribute to continuous improvement by identifying gaps in AI knowledge and suggesting targeted educational content.
  • Ensure all AI outputs adhere strictly to regulatory, ethical, and privacy guidelines in pharmacy practice.
  • Communicate complex pharmacy concepts clearly through both written reports and virtual team discussions.

Required Skills and Qualifications:

  • Active pharmacist license in good standing with substantial experience in drug dispensing and patient counseling.
  • Thorough understanding of drug interactions, contraindications, side effects, and evidence-based medication use.
  • Demonstrated excellence in both written and verbal communication, with a strong attention to detail.
  • Experience advising physicians and collaborating with multidisciplinary medical teams.
  • Keen interest in medical technology, clinical decision support, and AI solutions in healthcare.
  • High standards for accuracy, ethics, and patient safety in all professional undertakings.
  • Self-motivated, reliable, and comfortable working independently in a remote, part-time setting.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Prior experience in AI training, healthcare informatics, or pharmacy-related software development.
  • Advanced degree or certifications in clinical pharmacy, informatics, or a related field.
  • Familiarity with regulatory requirements governing digital health and data privacy.

• Provide detailed verbal and written feedback, utilizing industry terminology to describe nuances in vocal performance.

• Collaborate with AI engineers and linguists to refine voice algorithms and enhance model performance.

• Develop comprehensive evaluation criteria for voice characteristics such as tone, pitch, pacing, and clarity.

• Coach and instruct AI systems on a wide range of vocal styles, emotional deliveries, and accents.

• Document findings, track improvements, and suggest actionable insights for ongoing model training.

• Participate in regular virtual meetings to align project goals and share expertise.


Required Skills and Qualifications:

• Demonstrated expertise as a voice producer, speech coach, or professional voiceover artist.

• Exceptional written and verbal communication skills with a focus on clarity and precision.

• Advanced ability to discern and articulate subtle differences in vocal expression.

• Experience instructing or coaching others in vocal performance or technique.

• Strong attention to detail and commitment to high-quality deliverables.

• Comfort working independently in a remote, part-time capacity.

• Sound understanding of audio production principles and voice recording technology.


Preferred Qualifications:

• Previous experience collaborating on AI or machine learning projects.

• Familiarity with phonetics, linguistics, or relevant academic background.

• Track record of delivering constructive critique in creative or technical environments.


As a valued member of our customer's team, your insights will directly influence AI voice systems used by millions. We welcome voice producers, speech coaches, and accomplished voiceover professionals who are passionate about guiding and elevating vocal talent — not just performing, but shaping the standard for next-generation voice experiences.

descriptionHtml:
Job Title: Journalist or Reporter - AI trainer


Job Type: Part-time


Location: Remote


Job Summary:

Join our customer's team as a Journalist or Reporter - AI trainer and be at the forefront of shaping the future of AI-driven journalism. In this unique, remote, part-time role, you will leverage your expertise in news analysis and reporting to guide the development of next-generation AI models, ensuring high-quality and responsible news content.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop and refine AI training materials based on journalistic standards and ethical reporting principles.
  • Evaluate and provide constructive feedback on AI-generated news stories, articles, reviews, and commentaries across multiple media formats.
  • Contribute subject matter expertise to validate sources and enhance the accuracy and impartiality of AI-generated news content.
  • Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams to identify and address gaps in AI understanding of news media practices.
  • Collect, analyze, and synthesize information using traditional journalistic methods, including interviews, investigations, and observation.
  • Advise on best practices for news storytelling and audience engagement for print, broadcast, and digital platforms.
  • Document processes and findings to help improve AI news-writing capabilities.

Required Skills and Qualifications:

  • Proven experience as a journalist, news analyst, or reporter in print, broadcast, or digital media environments.
  • Strong command of journalistic ethics, standards, and source validation methodologies.
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with a keen attention to clarity, objectivity, and detail.
  • Experience narrating or writing news stories, reviews, or commentaries for various communications channels.
  • Ability to analyze information critically and provide actionable feedback.
  • Familiarity with AI, digital tools, or data-driven newsrooms is a plus.
  • Self-motivated, organized, and able to work independently in a virtual team setting.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience training or mentoring in newsroom environments or academic settings.
  • Prior work with AI or machine learning teams, especially related to language or media technologies.
  • Advanced degree in journalism, communications, or a related field.

title: Senior Product Designer
descriptionText:
As Senior Product Designer at NewTendermint, you will translate blockchain concepts and developer workflows into intuitive experiences that empower users to build and engage on Gno.land through Gno Studio and other tooling and dApps. NewTendermint’s DevX team is a product engineering team shaping the end-to-end developer and user journey for Gno.land. Your work will unite visual craft with product strategy so every tool is coherent, accessible and useful.
Responsibilities:Design developer experiences that span interactive authoring, system orchestration, discovery, and collaboration. Gno Studio supports browser-native development in gno, both local and distributed workflows, composable interfaces that embed in other environments, and programmable systems that evolve toward automation and agentic assistance.Model and communicate end-to-end workflows through wireframes, system maps, user journeys, and service blueprints.Drive and maintain the design system, including tokens, components, motion, accessibility to ensure visual and interaction consistency across Gno Studio, documentation, and future dApps.Prototype with purpose using tools like Figma, FigJam, ProtoPie, or lightweight HTML/CSS/JS when behavior fidelity is essential.Run and analyze usability sessions with builders, extract insights from telemetry, and iterate on copy, flows, and micro-interactions.Collaborate closely with engineers through async reviews in Figma or GitHub, shared Storybook work, and hands-on tweaks when needed.Shape design culture by mentoring peers, refining design ops practices, and aligning design direction with product and engineering leadership.
Requirements:6+ years designing and shipping digital products, including at least 2 years leading or owning creative direction.Portfolio demonstrates end-to-end product development, from research and exploration to interaction design and implementation. Experience with developer tools or complex technical products is a plus.Experience with web3 interaction models involving wallets, signature flows, contract execution, and the UX challenges of blockchain operations.Expertise in Figma: styles, variables, auto-layout, component structure, and inheritance. Comfortable in at least one prototyping or motion tool.Strong systems thinking: able to create and work with service blueprints, entity-relationship diagrams, and information architectures.Ability to shape implementation by working closely with engineers.Comfortable running basic user research: including remote usability testing, and applying findings to iterative design work.Clear communicator, both written and verbal, with proven effectiveness in a remote-first team culture.
Nice to Have:Experience with infrastructure or deployment-focused tools, especially where usability and abstraction were central to the design challenge.Ability to prototype or understand interaction requirements in code, and comfortable communicating with engineers about constraints and possibilities.Interest in emerging UX patterns like programmable interfaces, agentic behaviors, or design that adapts in real time.
About the Company
NewTendermint LLC is a blockchain-focused software development company that builds secure, scalable, open-source infrastructure for decentralized coordination. Our mission is to foster global, intelligent collaboration rooted in liberty and public accountability.We are actively developing Gno.land, a next-generation smart-contract platform powered by GnoVM, a decentralized operating system for censorship-resistant applications. At its core is Gno, a deterministic variant of the Go programming language that lets developers create composable packages and smart contracts directly on-chain.In parallel, we are leading the development of Tendermint2, the evolution of the original consensus engine that powered the Cosmos ecosystem, advancing performance and modularity for next-gen decentralized systems.
Through intuitive, developer-friendly tools and censorship-resistant infrastructure, NewTendermint empowers individuals and communities to build transparent, accountable systems for global-scale coordination.
Disclaimer
Direct applications only. NewTendermint LLC does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies in response to NewTendermint LLC website or social media posts. NewTendermint LLC will not consider or agree to payment of any referral compensation or recruiter fee relating to these unsolicited resumes. NewTendermint LLC explicitly reserves the right to hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency. Any unsolicited resume, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of NewTendermint LLC.
descriptionHtml:
As Senior Product Designer at NewTendermint, you will translate blockchain concepts and developer workflows into intuitive experiences that empower users to build and engage on Gno.land through Gno Studio and other tooling and dApps. NewTendermint’s DevX team is a product engineering team shaping the end-to-end developer and user journey for Gno.land. Your work will unite visual craft with product strategy so every tool is coherent, accessible and useful.


Responsibilities:

  • Design developer experiences that span interactive authoring, system orchestration, discovery, and collaboration. Gno Studio supports browser-native development in gno, both local and distributed workflows, composable interfaces that embed in other environments, and programmable systems that evolve toward automation and agentic assistance.
  • Model and communicate end-to-end workflows through wireframes, system maps, user journeys, and service blueprints.
  • Drive and maintain the design system, including tokens, components, motion, accessibility to ensure visual and interaction consistency across Gno Studio, documentation, and future dApps.
  • Prototype with purpose using tools like Figma, FigJam, ProtoPie, or lightweight HTML/CSS/JS when behavior fidelity is essential.
  • Run and analyze usability sessions with builders, extract insights from telemetry, and iterate on copy, flows, and micro-interactions.
  • Collaborate closely with engineers through async reviews in Figma or GitHub, shared Storybook work, and hands-on tweaks when needed.
  • Shape design culture by mentoring peers, refining design ops practices, and aligning design direction with product and engineering leadership.

Requirements:

  • 6+ years designing and shipping digital products, including at least 2 years leading or owning creative direction.
  • Portfolio demonstrates end-to-end product development, from research and exploration to interaction design and implementation. Experience with developer tools or complex technical products is a plus.
  • Experience with web3 interaction models involving wallets, signature flows, contract execution, and the UX challenges of blockchain operations.
  • Expertise in Figma: styles, variables, auto-layout, component structure, and inheritance. Comfortable in at least one prototyping or motion tool.
  • Strong systems thinking: able to create and work with service blueprints, entity-relationship diagrams, and information architectures.
  • Ability to shape implementation by working closely with engineers.
  • Comfortable running basic user research: including remote usability testing, and applying findings to iterative design work.
  • Clear communicator, both written and verbal, with proven effectiveness in a remote-first team culture.

Nice to Have:

  • Experience with infrastructure or deployment-focused tools, especially where usability and abstraction were central to the design challenge.
  • Ability to prototype or understand interaction requirements in code, and comfortable communicating with engineers about constraints and possibilities.
  • Interest in emerging UX patterns like programmable interfaces, agentic behaviors, or design that adapts in real time.

About the Company


NewTendermint LLC is a blockchain-focused software development company that builds secure, scalable, open-source infrastructure for decentralized coordination. Our mission is to foster global, intelligent collaboration rooted in liberty and public accountability.

We are actively developing Gno.land, a next-generation smart-contract platform powered by GnoVM, a decentralized operating system for censorship-resistant applications. At its core is Gno, a deterministic variant of the Go programming language that lets developers create composable packages and smart contracts directly on-chain.

In parallel, we are leading the development of Tendermint2, the evolution of the original consensus engine that powered the Cosmos ecosystem, advancing performance and modularity for next-gen decentralized systems.


Through intuitive, developer-friendly tools and censorship-resistant infrastructure, NewTendermint empowers individuals and communities to build transparent, accountable systems for global-scale coordination.


Disclaimer


Direct applications only. NewTendermint LLC does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies in response to NewTendermint LLC website or social media posts. NewTendermint LLC will not consider or agree to payment of any referral compensation or recruiter fee relating to these unsolicited resumes. NewTendermint LLC explicitly reserves the right to hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency. Any unsolicited resume, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of NewTendermint LLC.

company.name: All in Bits (AiB)
company.description:
All in Bits (AiB) aims to create a more transparent and accountable world through open-source software that enables permissionless innovation and borderless transactions. Our technology empowers builders to launch sovereign blockchains and decentralized applications (dApps) that are secure, scalable, and interoperable.

AiB is a longstanding contributor to the Cosmos ecosystem. In 2014, our CEO, Jae Kwon, was the first to introduce a solution to the Proof-of-Stake distributed consensus problem, building the core infrastructure that powers Cosmos today, including Tendermint Core and Cosmos SDK. AiB also conceptualized and contributed to the development of Cosmos' standard for blockchain interoperability, Inter-Blockchain Communication (IBC).  

We’re currently supporting the development of three new projects, Gno.land, Tendermint2, and Decentralists DAO, as well as the continued development of Ignite. From creating and funding to engineering and marketing, we prioritize simplistic and minimalistic approaches to building technological solutions that endure.

AiB is committed to upholding core Cosmos values of transparency, accountability, and decentralization. We aim to advance core components of the Cosmos tech stack and encourage open dialogue, informed decision-making, and bleeding-edge innovation.

title: Pharmacist - AI Trainer
descriptionText:
Job Type: Part-time
Location: Remote
Job Summary:Join our customer’s team as a Pharmacist - AI Trainer and play a pivotal role in shaping the accuracy and reliability of AI-powered medical platforms. Leverage your clinical expertise to review, train, and enhance artificial intelligence in delivering high-quality, medically-sound information for healthcare providers and patients.
Key Responsibilities:Analyze and review AI-generated content related to prescriptions, drug interactions, and patient education for medical accuracy and clarity.Offer expert feedback to optimize AI responses aligned with current pharmaceutical standards and patient safety protocols.Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams to design training sets based on real-world pharmacy scenarios and best practices.Advise on medication selection, proper dosage, contraindications, and emerging pharmaceutical therapies to ensure comprehensive AI solutions.Contribute to continuous improvement by identifying gaps in AI knowledge and suggesting targeted educational content.Ensure all AI outputs adhere strictly to regulatory, ethical, and privacy guidelines in pharmacy practice.Communicate complex pharmacy concepts clearly through both written reports and virtual team discussions.
Required Skills and Qualifications:Active pharmacist license in good standing with substantial experience in drug dispensing and patient counseling.Thorough understanding of drug interactions, contraindications, side effects, and evidence-based medication use.Demonstrated excellence in both written and verbal communication, with a strong attention to detail.Experience advising physicians and collaborating with multidisciplinary medical teams.Keen interest in medical technology, clinical decision support, and AI solutions in healthcare.High standards for accuracy, ethics, and patient safety in all professional undertakings.Self-motivated, reliable, and comfortable working independently in a remote, part-time setting.
Preferred Qualifications:Prior experience in AI training, healthcare informatics, or pharmacy-related software development.Advanced degree or certifications in clinical pharmacy, informatics, or a related field.Familiarity with regulatory requirements governing digital health and data privacy.
descriptionHtml:
Job Type: Part-time


Location: Remote


Job Summary:

Join our customer’s team as a Pharmacist - AI Trainer and play a pivotal role in shaping the accuracy and reliability of AI-powered medical platforms. Leverage your clinical expertise to review, train, and enhance artificial intelligence in delivering high-quality, medically-sound information for healthcare providers and patients.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Analyze and review AI-generated content related to prescriptions, drug interactions, and patient education for medical accuracy and clarity.
  • Offer expert feedback to optimize AI responses aligned with current pharmaceutical standards and patient safety protocols.
  • Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams to design training sets based on real-world pharmacy scenarios and best practices.
  • Advise on medication selection, proper dosage, contraindications, and emerging pharmaceutical therapies to ensure comprehensive AI solutions.
  • Contribute to continuous improvement by identifying gaps in AI knowledge and suggesting targeted educational content.
  • Ensure all AI outputs adhere strictly to regulatory, ethical, and privacy guidelines in pharmacy practice.
  • Communicate complex pharmacy concepts clearly through both written reports and virtual team discussions.

Required Skills and Qualifications:

  • Active pharmacist license in good standing with substantial experience in drug dispensing and patient counseling.
  • Thorough understanding of drug interactions, contraindications, side effects, and evidence-based medication use.
  • Demonstrated excellence in both written and verbal communication, with a strong attention to detail.
  • Experience advising physicians and collaborating with multidisciplinary medical teams.
  • Keen interest in medical technology, clinical decision support, and AI solutions in healthcare.
  • High standards for accuracy, ethics, and patient safety in all professional undertakings.
  • Self-motivated, reliable, and comfortable working independently in a remote, part-time setting.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Prior experience in AI training, healthcare informatics, or pharmacy-related software development.
  • Advanced degree or certifications in clinical pharmacy, informatics, or a related field.
  • Familiarity with regulatory requirements governing digital health and data privacy.

title: Senior Design Manager (Infrastructure)
descriptionText:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1200+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.

The company is founder led, profitable and growing.

We are hiring a senior design manager to play a key role making open source software available to the world. Our Design function ensures the experience of the software and infrastructure we build is true to our intentions, and delivers the tools our community and customers need. The Design Manager makes this possible through leadership within, and beyond, our teams.

As a Senior Design Manager, you bring both experience managing design teams and have expertise in a deeply technical domain. This enables you to coach designers in creating tools for developers and cloud engineers, and cross-context to move towards tangible outcomes and lift the quality of their work. You will manage expectations and ensure deadlines are met in a timely manner against your roadmap. You will be able to communicate clearly and actively listen to product and engineering stakeholders, and your team, to drive sustainable quality improvements and guide individuals towards meaningful growth.

Leading the Infrastructure Design team, you will take responsibility for the products that help to build cloud experiences and software distribution mechanisms, and you will help to evolve the security of how software is packaged and delivered.

Location: This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region

What the role entails

Reviewing the work of your design team for qualityWorking with individual designers to support their professional growthContinuously improving operational workflows, including production outsourcing and collaboration with Web EngineeringWorking with stakeholders, especially the Engineering organization, to clearly define and validate outcomesEvolving design systems and guidelines to drive consistent quality and improve efficiencyCoordinating with the rest of design leadership to mature our collective practiceBringing your team and others together to share their work and strengthen cultureEngaging the open source community to learn and make the value of our work legible


What we are looking for in you

A portfolio demonstrating outstanding quality in UX design and savviness in technologyExceptional educational achievements in design or related behavioral science disciplineFull lifecycle experience from user needs discovery through validation and implementation guidanceCommitment to transparent project delivery and owning team deadlinesExperience of managing a team that interacts with technical stakeholdersFamiliarity with quantitative optimisation approachesA passion for balancing consistency and innovationWillingness to travel up to 4 times a year for internal events


What we offer you

Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits below, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.

In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.

Fully remote working environment - we’ve been working remotely since 2004!Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annumAnnual compensation reviewRecognition rewardsAnnual holiday leaveParental LeaveEmployee Assistance ProgrammeOpportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at ‘sprints’Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events


About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.

Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

company.name: Canonical
company.description:
We deliver open source to the world faster,  more securely and more cost effectively than any other company.

We're also the publishers of Ubuntu, the world’s most popular enterprise Linux from cloud to edge, together with a passionate global community of 200,000+ contributors. 

Ubuntu means 'humanity to others'​. We chose it because it embodies the generosity at the heart of open source, the new normal for platforms and innovation.

Together with a community of 200,000, we publish an operating system that runs from the tiny connected devices up to the world's biggest mainframes, the platform that everybody uses on the public cloud, and the workstation experience of the world's most productive developers.

Secure and reliable, elegant and intuitive, and open for innovation - this is the future of open source, which is why we're proud to be the developers of the fastest growing Linux in the world despite already being the most widely deployed.

If you're interested in a career at Canonical, we are a remote-first company so please apply to any suitable role as skills are valued more than location, despite some having a preferred geographic preference. 

www.canonical.com

title: Product Designer
descriptionText:
Fuse Energy is seeking a talented and creative Product Designer to join our innovative team. In this role, you will work closely with operations managers, front-end developers, and backend engineers to build a 10X consumer product that revolutionizes the renewable energy space for everyday consumers. You'll have the opportunity to work across multiple platforms, including mobile applications on iOS and Android, websites, and eventually, responsive web applications. Additionally, you'll be responsible for generating creative collateral for various consumer touchpoints of the product.

Responsibilities:

Working directly with the CEO and co-founder to build a groundbreaking consumer productDesign and iterate on user interfaces for mobile applications, websites, and responsive web applicationsGenerate creative collateral for consumer touchpoints, ensuring consistency and brand integrityParticipate in scoping and conceptualization sessions to define product requirements and user needsDrive the ideation of new features and functionality, contributing innovative solutions to enhance user experienceConduct user research, usability testing, and gather feedback to inform design decisionsAdapt quickly to evolving project requirements and proactively seek opportunities for improvementMaintain design consistency and standards across all platforms and devices

Requirements

descriptionHtml:
Fuse Energy is seeking a talented and creative Product Designer to join our innovative team. In this role, you will work closely with operations managers, front-end developers, and backend engineers to build a 10X consumer product that revolutionizes the renewable energy space for everyday consumers. You'll have the opportunity to work across multiple platforms, including mobile applications on iOS and Android, websites, and eventually, responsive web applications. Additionally, you'll be responsible for generating creative collateral for various consumer touchpoints of the product.



Responsibilities:



  • Working directly with the CEO and co-founder to build a groundbreaking consumer product
  • Design and iterate on user interfaces for mobile applications, websites, and responsive web applications
  • Generate creative collateral for consumer touchpoints, ensuring consistency and brand integrity
  • Participate in scoping and conceptualization sessions to define product requirements and user needs
  • Drive the ideation of new features and functionality, contributing innovative solutions to enhance user experience
  • Conduct user research, usability testing, and gather feedback to inform design decisions
  • Adapt quickly to evolving project requirements and proactively seek opportunities for improvement
  • Maintain design consistency and standards across all platforms and devices



Requirements



  • 3+ years product design experience using Figma
  • Experience designing consumer-facing products in data-driven environments
  • Evidence of strong visual sensibility (graphic, typography, alternative media)
  • Experience with motion graphics (2D / 3D)
  • Hold a Bachelor's degree in a highly analytical discipline



Benefits



  • Competitive salary and a stock options sign-on bonus
  • Biannual bonus scheme
  • Fully expensed tech to match your needs!
  • Paid annual leave
  • Breakfast and dinner for office based employees

Energy is broken – We are here to fix it.

title: Staff Technical Program Manager
descriptionText:
MongoDB’s mission is to empower innovators to create, transform, and disrupt industries by unleashing the power of software and data. We enable organizations of all sizes to easily build, scale, and run modern applications by helping them modernize legacy workloads, embrace innovation, and unleash AI. Our industry-leading developer data platform, MongoDB Atlas, is the only globally distributed, multi-cloud database and is available in more than 115 regions across AWS, Google Cloud, and Microsoft Azure. Atlas allows customers to build and run applications anywhere—on premises, or across cloud providers. With offices worldwide and over 175,000 new developers signing up to use MongoDB every month, it’s no wonder that leading organizations, like Samsung and Toyota, trust MongoDB to build next-generation, AI-powered applications.

As a Staff Technical Program Manager, you will own the successful delivery of complex, cross-functional efforts. You will partner closely with stakeholders across the organization from Engineering, Product, Product Design, and even Field-facing teams to develop and execute against our overall product vision and business objectives, uncover solutions to technical challenges, and provide data-driven insights that power strategic decision-making.

Position Expectations

Leverage technical acumen and analytical skills to drive engineering programs forward and maximize business value deliveryRecognize patterns in a sea of information and take action accordinglyDevelop a strategic approach to program management that balances agility and process. This involves discerning when to provide direct guidance and when to empower teams by establishing clear frameworks and guidelines for ongoing initiativesBuild strategic partnerships with Product, Design, and Engineering stakeholdersExpand knowledge into new domains as called uponAct as a mentor to junior TPMs and lead by exampleEmbody MongoDB's core values and leadership principles

The right candidate for this role will be

Experienced with 10+ years of working in an engineering organization leading complex cross-functional technical programsExperienced with 5+ years of Software development backgroundAble to partner with technical stakeholders in methodically breaking down engineering challenges to deliver against abstract goalsAble to participate in technical design discussions and summarize trade-offs, outcomes, and next stepsSkilled at communicating across a diverse set of engineers and stakeholdersCapable of deep user empathy and adept at balancing product goals and engineering constraints to deliver impactful experiencesHyper-organized and capable of coordinating across multiple independent work streams and organizationsA role model for effective execution practices, driven by an attuned sense of priority and urgencyAble to leverage their experience in program delivery to influence improvements to our tools, operations, architectureTrained in working with project tracking software (e.g. Jira, Rally, MS Project)Familiar with MongoDB or a comparable technology

Nice to have!

Exposed to generative AI and Machine LearningInterested in business automation work such as scripting in Python, Google Apps Script and SlackFamiliar with tools and methodologies for code analysis, refactoring, and automated testing

To drive the personal growth and business impact of our employees, we’re committed to developing a supportive and enriching culture for everyone. From employee affinity groups, to fertility assistance and a generous parental leave policy, we value our employees’ wellbeing and want to support them along every step of their professional and personal journeys. Learn more about what it’s like to work at MongoDB, and help us make an impact on the world!

MongoDB is committed to providing any necessary accommodations for individuals with disabilities within our application and interview process. To request an accommodation due to a disability, please inform your recruiter.

MongoDB, Inc. provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type and makes all hiring decisions without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

REQ ID: 425283

MongoDB’s base salary range for this role is posted below. Compensation at the time of offer is unique to each candidate and based on a variety of factors such as skill set, experience, qualifications, and work location. Salary is one part of MongoDB’s total compensation and benefits package. Other benefits for eligible employees may include: equity, participation in the employee stock purchase program, flexible paid time off, 20 weeks fully-paid gender-neutral parental leave, fertility and adoption assistance, 401(k) plan, mental health counseling, access to transgender-inclusive health insurance coverage, and health benefits offerings. Please note, the base salary range listed below and the benefits in this paragraph are only applicable to U.S.-based candidates.

MongoDB’s base salary range for this role in the U.S. is:

$115,000—$226,000 USD

title: Senior Software Engineer
descriptionText:
Staff Software Engineer (Java Backend)
Underdog.io is a modern recruiting platform. One of our hiring partners is looking to hire a Senior Software Engineer.
About the CompanyOur hiring partner is a pioneering crypto and Web3 platform, driving global financial empowerment through decentralized technology. Founded 10 years ago, they serve millions of users across 70+ countries with secure, scalable solutions for crypto trading, payments, and asset management. Their mission is to unlock financial autonomy through elegant, user-first products.
The RoleAs a Senior Software Engineer, you’ll lead backend development for mission-critical payment infrastructure powering crypto transfers and fiat transactions. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to architect systems that process billions in assets securely and efficiently.
Key ResponsibilitiesOwn end-to-end development of high-availability backend services using Java/Scala, focusing on deposit/withdrawal systems for crypto and fiat assets.Optimize developer velocity by improving CI/CD pipelines, test automation, and local development workflows.Conduct large-scale refactoring to reduce technical debt while maintaining 99.99% uptime SLAs for payment systems.Lead architectural decisions balancing scalability, security, and regulatory compliance in fintech environments.Mentor junior engineers through code reviews, and design sessions.Partner with product teams to translate compliance requirements into technical solutions (e.g., transaction monitoring)
Qualifications8+ years of backend development with 5+ years in Java (Spring Boot/Quarkus) or Scala (Cats/ZIO ecosystems).Expertise building distributed systems handling 10k+ TPS (event-driven architectures, Kafka/RabbitMQ).Mastery of SQL/NoSQL databases (PostgreSQL, Cassandra) and caching strategies (Redis, Memcached).Proven track record optimizing cloud-native systems (AWS/GCP) using Kubernetes, Terraform, and Prometheus/Grafana.Deep understanding of fintech security standards (PCI DSS, cryptography) and financial settlement workflows is a huge plus.BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent experience scaling systems to 1M+ users.
Leadership RequirementsExperience driving multi-quarter technical roadmaps with stakeholder alignment.Ability to simplify complex technical concepts for executives and auditors.History of leading incident response for P0 outages in production systems.
Why Join$172k–$241k base salary + equity + annual bonus (top 10% industry compensation).100% covered medical/dental/vision + 5% 401k match.Unlimited PTO + 16-week parental leave + $10k/year learning stipend.Remote-first culture with quarterly team summits in global tech hubs.
descriptionHtml:
Staff Software Engineer (Java Backend)


Underdog.io is a modern recruiting platform. One of our hiring partners is looking to hire a Senior Software Engineer.


About the Company

Our hiring partner is a pioneering crypto and Web3 platform, driving global financial empowerment through decentralized technology. Founded 10 years ago, they serve millions of users across 70+ countries with secure, scalable solutions for crypto trading, payments, and asset management. Their mission is to unlock financial autonomy through elegant, user-first products.


The Role

As a Senior Software Engineer, you’ll lead backend development for mission-critical payment infrastructure powering crypto transfers and fiat transactions. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to architect systems that process billions in assets securely and efficiently.


Key Responsibilities

  • Own end-to-end development of high-availability backend services using Java/Scala, focusing on deposit/withdrawal systems for crypto and fiat assets.
  • Optimize developer velocity by improving CI/CD pipelines, test automation, and local development workflows.
  • Conduct large-scale refactoring to reduce technical debt while maintaining 99.99% uptime SLAs for payment systems.
  • Lead architectural decisions balancing scalability, security, and regulatory compliance in fintech environments.
  • Mentor junior engineers through code reviews, and design sessions.
  • Partner with product teams to translate compliance requirements into technical solutions (e.g., transaction monitoring)

Qualifications

  • 8+ years of backend development with 5+ years in Java (Spring Boot/Quarkus) or Scala (Cats/ZIO ecosystems).
  • Expertise building distributed systems handling 10k+ TPS (event-driven architectures, Kafka/RabbitMQ).
  • Mastery of SQL/NoSQL databases (PostgreSQL, Cassandra) and caching strategies (Redis, Memcached).
  • Proven track record optimizing cloud-native systems (AWS/GCP) using Kubernetes, Terraform, and Prometheus/Grafana.
  • Deep understanding of fintech security standards (PCI DSS, cryptography) and financial settlement workflows is a huge plus.
  • BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent experience scaling systems to 1M+ users.

Leadership Requirements

  • Experience driving multi-quarter technical roadmaps with stakeholder alignment.
  • Ability to simplify complex technical concepts for executives and auditors.
  • History of leading incident response for P0 outages in production systems.

Why Join

  • $172k–$241k base salary + equity + annual bonus (top 10% industry compensation).
  • 100% covered medical/dental/vision + 5% 401k match.
  • Unlimited PTO + 16-week parental leave + $10k/year learning stipend.
  • Remote-first culture with quarterly team summits in global tech hubs.

company.name: Underdog.io -Apply to top tech jobs in 60 seconds. A place where companies apply to you
company.description:
Underdog.io builds software that helps engineering and product job seekers find their ideal job with one application. Since launching in April 2014, we’ve connected thousands of candidates with hundreds of growing organizations hiring across the United States.

Candidates send Underdog.io their resumes and other basic information. Using a combination of human intelligence and technology, Underdog.io reviews and ranks candidates and sends a curated batch to our hiring network every week. Founders and hiring managers contact candidates directly and take them through their normal internal hiring process.
