title: Salesforce QA Tester
descriptionText:
Salesforce QA Tester | Remote | £40,000 - £50,000
I'm working with an innovative company seeking a Salesforce QA Tester to join their team. This company is at the forefront of a significant transformation, providing you with a unique opportunity to influence a greenfield project from its inception.
Although they have offices in the Midlands, they offer a fully remote working arrangement, fostering a flexible and supportive work environment. This company is characterised by its small, friendly atmosphere where collaboration and personal growth are highly valued. Their ongoing projects are not just transformative for the business but also offer significant learning and development opportunities for their employees.
As a Salesforce QA Tester here, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring the quality and reliability of Salesforce implementations, with a strong focus on telephony integrations and Salesforce CPQ. You’ll work closely with developers, business analysts, and release managers to validate complex configurations and ensure seamless user experiences.
Key Responsibilities:Test and validate Salesforce CPQ configurations and telephony integrations.Collaborate with developers and stakeholders to ensure accurate implementation of pricing, quoting, and call-handling workflows.Identify and troubleshoot issues across the Salesforce platform, including CPQ logic and telephony flows.Support end-to-end testing cycles and contribute to continuous improvement of QA processes.
Ideal Candidate:Proven experience testing Salesforce CPQ and/or telephony solutions (e.g., Amazon Connect, Genesys, Twilio).Strong understanding of Salesforce data models, quoting processes, and call routing logic.Familiarity with Git and CI/CD tools is a plus.Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.Open to candidates from various backgrounds who are eager to grow in a QA role with a focus on CPQ and telephony.
Sound interesting? Click APPLY to find out more or get in touch at kim.ocallaghan@opusrs.com

title: Quality Assurance Automation Engineer
descriptionText:
Mid/Snr QA Automation Engineer - Blockchain / DLT – JavaScript, Cypress, CI/CD, API Testing - £60K - Fully Remote
Oliver Bernard are currently working with an industry leading Blockchain / DLT firm, who are ramping up their Platform at a speed of knots to scale in line with their continued growth.
They are looking for a Mid/Snr QA Automation Engineer, to join their QA team as part of ongoing expansion plans across Technology, particular their Testing function, as they look to drive out their Automation practices.
This position is an ideal opportunity for a Mid/Snr level profile looking to build in their career, have autonomy in their work, and progress in a fast paced, established, and friendly environment.
To be considered, you will need the following experience:
Strong Automation experience in JavaScript environmentsHands-on work with associated frameworks such as Cypress, Playwright, WebdriverIO etcCI/CD with Git, or equivalent (Jenkins, ArgoCD etc)Prior experience across API Testing (with REST, Postman or equivalent)
This position is able to offer up to £60K on the base salary, alongside benefits, and is a remote opportunity for UK based profiles. Please apply to register interest in this opportunity.
Mid/Snr QA Automation Engineer - Blockchain / DLT – JavaScript, Cypress, CI/CD, API Testing - £60K - Fully Remote

Mid/Snr QA Automation Engineer - Blockchain / DLT – JavaScript, Cypress, CI/CD, API Testing - £60K - Fully Remote


Oliver Bernard are currently working with an industry leading Blockchain / DLT firm, who are ramping up their Platform at a speed of knots to scale in line with their continued growth.


They are looking for a Mid/Snr QA Automation Engineer, to join their QA team as part of ongoing expansion plans across Technology, particular their Testing function, as they look to drive out their Automation practices.


This position is an ideal opportunity for a Mid/Snr level profile looking to build in their career, have autonomy in their work, and progress in a fast paced, established, and friendly environment.


To be considered, you will need the following experience:


  • Strong Automation experience in JavaScript environments
  • Hands-on work with associated frameworks such as Cypress, Playwright, WebdriverIO etc
  • CI/CD with Git, or equivalent (Jenkins, ArgoCD etc)
  • Prior experience across API Testing (with REST, Postman or equivalent)

This position is able to offer up to £60K on the base salary, alongside benefits, and is a remote opportunity for UK based profiles. Please apply to register interest in this opportunity.


Mid/Snr QA Automation Engineer - Blockchain / DLT – JavaScript, Cypress, CI/CD, API Testing - £60K - Fully Remote

title: Junior QA Automation Engineer
descriptionText:
Position: Junior QA Automation Engineer

Location: UK Remote

Reports to: Head of Development

About Us

At Happydance, we’re redefining HR technology through innovative, user-centric digital solutions. We believe in delivering exceptional experiences to our clients, and quality assurance is at the heart of everything we do. Join our team as a Junior QA Automation Engineer and play a critical role in ensuring the delivery of high-quality, scalable, and reliable software solutions.

Role Overview

As a Junior QA Automation Engineer, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining automated test frameworks and scripts to ensure the quality and functionality of our products. Working closely with development and product teams, you will help define and uphold quality standards, troubleshoot issues, and drive continuous improvement in our testing processes.

Key Responsibilities

Test Automation:

Design, develop, and maintain automated test frameworks and scripts for functional, regression, and performance testing. Implement and execute automated tests to identify bugs and ensure product quality. Continuously optimize automation frameworks to improve efficiency and scalability. 

Quality Assurance:

Collaborate with development and product teams to understand requirements and define test strategies. Identify and document test cases, scenarios, and test data for automation. Perform root cause analysis on defects and work with developers to resolve issues. Maintain comprehensive test documentation, including test plans, reports, and results. 

Continuous Integration and Delivery (CI/CD):

Integrate automated tests into CI/CD pipelines to enable continuous testing and deployment. Monitor test results in CI/CD environments and provide timely feedback to stakeholders. 

Process Improvement:

Advocate for quality best practices across the organization. Stay updated on industry trends and emerging technologies in QA and test automation. Proactively identify areas for process improvement and implement innovative solutions. From time to time, you may be required to work flexibly to accommodate our valued US-based customers, ensuring our global commitment to exceptional service. 

Qualifications & Skills

The Must-Haves:

Proven experience in QA automation, with expertise in designing and implementing test frameworks. Proficiency in programming languages such as Java, Python, or JavaScript for test automation. Strong experience with automation tools like Selenium, Cypress, Appium, or similar. Familiarity with API testing tools such as Postman or RestAssured. Knowledge of CI/CD tools (e.g., Jenkins, GitHub Actions, Azure DevOps) and version control systems (e.g., Git). Solid understanding of software testing principles, methodologies, and best practices. Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Strong communication and collaboration skills. 

The Nice-to-Haves

Experience in performance testing tools like JMeter or LoadRunner. Familiarity with cloud environments (e.g., AWS, Azure) and containerization tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes). Knowledge of security testing and tools. ISTQB or equivalent certification. 

Why Join Us?

Impactful Work: Contribute to delivering high-quality software solutions that make a difference. Collaborative Culture: Work with a supportive team that values innovation and excellence. Professional Growth: Access opportunities for training, mentorship, and career advancement. Flexible Work: Benefit from competitive compensation, bonus opportunities, and remote working arrangements. 

Our Core Values 

We See you. (The one about empathy) We not only understand, but we feel what customers and candidates are experiencing We take care. (The one about Thoughtfulness) We use deep understanding to take careful, intentional action that improves experiences. We’ve got this. (The one about collaboration We have complete trust in each other’s unique skills and know we will succeed as a team when we work together. We’re all in. (The one about focus) We’re obsessed with experiences that move people, and we use this discipline to stay aligned with our mission: to deliver the best possible candidate and customer experience. We make it happen. (The one about action) We’re never static. Our expertise, solutions and service are constantly evolving, and we’re always innovating to deliver competitive advantage 

Apply Now

If you’re a skilled Junior QA Automation Engineer with a passion for quality and innovation, we’d love to hear from you. Join Happydance and help us deliver exceptional digital experiences to our clients and users.

title: Pharmacist - AI Trainer
descriptionText:
Job Type: Part-time
Location: Remote
Job Summary:Join our customer’s team as a Pharmacist - AI Trainer and play a pivotal role in shaping the accuracy and reliability of AI-powered medical platforms. Leverage your clinical expertise to review, train, and enhance artificial intelligence in delivering high-quality, medically-sound information for healthcare providers and patients.
Key Responsibilities:Analyze and review AI-generated content related to prescriptions, drug interactions, and patient education for medical accuracy and clarity.Offer expert feedback to optimize AI responses aligned with current pharmaceutical standards and patient safety protocols.Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams to design training sets based on real-world pharmacy scenarios and best practices.Advise on medication selection, proper dosage, contraindications, and emerging pharmaceutical therapies to ensure comprehensive AI solutions.Contribute to continuous improvement by identifying gaps in AI knowledge and suggesting targeted educational content.Ensure all AI outputs adhere strictly to regulatory, ethical, and privacy guidelines in pharmacy practice.Communicate complex pharmacy concepts clearly through both written reports and virtual team discussions.
Required Skills and Qualifications:Active pharmacist license in good standing with substantial experience in drug dispensing and patient counseling.Thorough understanding of drug interactions, contraindications, side effects, and evidence-based medication use.Demonstrated excellence in both written and verbal communication, with a strong attention to detail.Experience advising physicians and collaborating with multidisciplinary medical teams.Keen interest in medical technology, clinical decision support, and AI solutions in healthcare.High standards for accuracy, ethics, and patient safety in all professional undertakings.Self-motivated, reliable, and comfortable working independently in a remote, part-time setting.
Preferred Qualifications:Prior experience in AI training, healthcare informatics, or pharmacy-related software development.Advanced degree or certifications in clinical pharmacy, informatics, or a related field.Familiarity with regulatory requirements governing digital health and data privacy.
descriptionHtml:
Job Type: Part-time


Location: Remote


Job Summary:

Join our customer’s team as a Pharmacist - AI Trainer and play a pivotal role in shaping the accuracy and reliability of AI-powered medical platforms. Leverage your clinical expertise to review, train, and enhance artificial intelligence in delivering high-quality, medically-sound information for healthcare providers and patients.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Analyze and review AI-generated content related to prescriptions, drug interactions, and patient education for medical accuracy and clarity.
  • Offer expert feedback to optimize AI responses aligned with current pharmaceutical standards and patient safety protocols.
  • Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams to design training sets based on real-world pharmacy scenarios and best practices.
  • Advise on medication selection, proper dosage, contraindications, and emerging pharmaceutical therapies to ensure comprehensive AI solutions.
  • Contribute to continuous improvement by identifying gaps in AI knowledge and suggesting targeted educational content.
  • Ensure all AI outputs adhere strictly to regulatory, ethical, and privacy guidelines in pharmacy practice.
  • Communicate complex pharmacy concepts clearly through both written reports and virtual team discussions.

Required Skills and Qualifications:

  • Active pharmacist license in good standing with substantial experience in drug dispensing and patient counseling.
  • Thorough understanding of drug interactions, contraindications, side effects, and evidence-based medication use.
  • Demonstrated excellence in both written and verbal communication, with a strong attention to detail.
  • Experience advising physicians and collaborating with multidisciplinary medical teams.
  • Keen interest in medical technology, clinical decision support, and AI solutions in healthcare.
  • High standards for accuracy, ethics, and patient safety in all professional undertakings.
  • Self-motivated, reliable, and comfortable working independently in a remote, part-time setting.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Prior experience in AI training, healthcare informatics, or pharmacy-related software development.
  • Advanced degree or certifications in clinical pharmacy, informatics, or a related field.
  • Familiarity with regulatory requirements governing digital health and data privacy.

Location: Remote

This role involves guiding AI in mastering diverse accents and dialects, utilizing your expertise in voice directing. Work remotely in a dynamic environment on an audio description mini-pilot project.
Key Responsibilities:• Collaborate with AI developers to enhance voice recognition and synthesis.• Provide expert guidance on accents and regional dialects for AI training.• Conduct intensive voice coaching sessions focused on dialect accuracy.• Evaluate and improve AI’s audio output for clarity and authenticity.• Develop training materials for AI voice modulation and inflection.• Assist in testing and refining AI’s accent capabilities.• Document progress and report findings to the development team.
Required Skills and Qualifications:• Proven experience as a voice coach with professional voice acting background.• Expertise in a wide range of accents and regional dialects.• Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.• Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a remote setup.• Familiarity with audio editing tools and software.• Experience in voice directing for diverse projects.
Preferred Qualifications:• Previous experience in AI or technology-driven projects.• Knowledge of emerging trends in voice synthesis and AI learning.• Experience creating comprehensive voice training modules.

title: Speech Coach - AI Tutor
descriptionText:
Job Title: Voice Expert - AI Trainer
Job Type: Part-Time or Full-time
Location: Remote
Job Summary:Join our customer's team as a Voice Expert - AI Trainer, where your specialized knowledge in voice production, speech coaching, or voiceover artistry will help shape the future of AI voice technology. In this dynamic role, you will leverage your acute listening skills and extensive voice-related vocabulary to provide invaluable training and feedback, playing a pivotal role in elevating AI-generated voice output.
Key Responsibilities:• Analyze and evaluate AI-generated voice samples for accuracy, naturalness, and expressiveness.• Provide detailed verbal and written feedback, utilizing industry terminology to describe nuances in vocal performance.• Collaborate with AI engineers and linguists to refine voice algorithms and enhance model performance.• Develop comprehensive evaluation criteria for voice characteristics such as tone, pitch, pacing, and clarity.• Coach and instruct AI systems on a wide range of vocal styles, emotional deliveries, and accents.• Document findings, track improvements, and suggest actionable insights for ongoing model training.• Participate in regular virtual meetings to align project goals and share expertise.
Required Skills and Qualifications:• Demonstrated expertise as a voice producer, speech coach, or professional voiceover artist.• Exceptional written and verbal communication skills with a focus on clarity and precision.• Advanced ability to discern and articulate subtle differences in vocal expression.• Experience instructing or coaching others in vocal performance or technique.• Strong attention to detail and commitment to high-quality deliverables.• Comfort working independently in a remote, part-time capacity.• Sound understanding of audio production principles and voice recording technology.
Preferred Qualifications:• Previous experience collaborating on AI or machine learning projects.• Familiarity with phonetics, linguistics, or relevant academic background.• Track record of delivering constructive critique in creative or technical environments.
As a valued member of our customer's team, your insights will directly influence AI voice systems used by millions. We welcome voice producers, speech coaches, and accomplished voiceover professionals who are passionate about guiding and elevating vocal talent — not just performing, but shaping the standard for next-generation voice experiences.
descriptionHtml:
Job Title: Voice Expert - AI Trainer


Job Type: Part-Time or Full-time


Location: Remote


Job Summary:

Join our customer's team as a Voice Expert - AI Trainer, where your specialized knowledge in voice production, speech coaching, or voiceover artistry will help shape the future of AI voice technology. In this dynamic role, you will leverage your acute listening skills and extensive voice-related vocabulary to provide invaluable training and feedback, playing a pivotal role in elevating AI-generated voice output.


Key Responsibilities:

• Analyze and evaluate AI-generated voice samples for accuracy, naturalness, and expressiveness.

• Provide detailed verbal and written feedback, utilizing industry terminology to describe nuances in vocal performance.

• Collaborate with AI engineers and linguists to refine voice algorithms and enhance model performance.

• Develop comprehensive evaluation criteria for voice characteristics such as tone, pitch, pacing, and clarity.

• Coach and instruct AI systems on a wide range of vocal styles, emotional deliveries, and accents.

• Document findings, track improvements, and suggest actionable insights for ongoing model training.

• Participate in regular virtual meetings to align project goals and share expertise.


Required Skills and Qualifications:

• Demonstrated expertise as a voice producer, speech coach, or professional voiceover artist.

• Exceptional written and verbal communication skills with a focus on clarity and precision.

• Advanced ability to discern and articulate subtle differences in vocal expression.

• Experience instructing or coaching others in vocal performance or technique.

• Strong attention to detail and commitment to high-quality deliverables.

• Comfort working independently in a remote, part-time capacity.

• Sound understanding of audio production principles and voice recording technology.


Preferred Qualifications:

• Previous experience collaborating on AI or machine learning projects.

• Familiarity with phonetics, linguistics, or relevant academic background.

• Track record of delivering constructive critique in creative or technical environments.


As a valued member of our customer's team, your insights will directly influence AI voice systems used by millions. We welcome voice producers, speech coaches, and accomplished voiceover professionals who are passionate about guiding and elevating vocal talent — not just performing, but shaping the standard for next-generation voice experiences.

title: Journalist or Reporter - AI trainer
descriptionText:

Job Type: Part-time
Location: Remote
Job Summary:Join our customer's team as a Journalist or Reporter - AI trainer and be at the forefront of shaping the future of AI-driven journalism. In this unique, remote, part-time role, you will leverage your expertise in news analysis and reporting to guide the development of next-generation AI models, ensuring high-quality and responsible news content.
Key Responsibilities:Develop and refine AI training materials based on journalistic standards and ethical reporting principles.Evaluate and provide constructive feedback on AI-generated news stories, articles, reviews, and commentaries across multiple media formats.Contribute subject matter expertise to validate sources and enhance the accuracy and impartiality of AI-generated news content.Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams to identify and address gaps in AI understanding of news media practices.Collect, analyze, and synthesize information using traditional journalistic methods, including interviews, investigations, and observation.Advise on best practices for news storytelling and audience engagement for print, broadcast, and digital platforms.Document processes and findings to help improve AI news-writing capabilities.
Required Skills and Qualifications:Proven experience as a journalist, news analyst, or reporter in print, broadcast, or digital media environments.Strong command of journalistic ethics, standards, and source validation methodologies.Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with a keen attention to clarity, objectivity, and detail.Experience narrating or writing news stories, reviews, or commentaries for various communications channels.Ability to analyze information critically and provide actionable feedback.Familiarity with AI, digital tools, or data-driven newsrooms is a plus.Self-motivated, organized, and able to work independently in a virtual team setting.
Preferred Qualifications:Experience training or mentoring in newsroom environments or academic settings.Prior work with AI or machine learning teams, especially related to language or media technologies.Advanced degree in journalism, communications, or a related field.
descriptionHtml:
Job Title: Journalist or Reporter - AI trainer


Job Type: Part-time


Location: Remote


Job Summary:

Join our customer's team as a Journalist or Reporter - AI trainer and be at the forefront of shaping the future of AI-driven journalism. In this unique, remote, part-time role, you will leverage your expertise in news analysis and reporting to guide the development of next-generation AI models, ensuring high-quality and responsible news content.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop and refine AI training materials based on journalistic standards and ethical reporting principles.
  • Evaluate and provide constructive feedback on AI-generated news stories, articles, reviews, and commentaries across multiple media formats.
  • Contribute subject matter expertise to validate sources and enhance the accuracy and impartiality of AI-generated news content.
  • Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams to identify and address gaps in AI understanding of news media practices.
  • Collect, analyze, and synthesize information using traditional journalistic methods, including interviews, investigations, and observation.
  • Advise on best practices for news storytelling and audience engagement for print, broadcast, and digital platforms.
  • Document processes and findings to help improve AI news-writing capabilities.

Required Skills and Qualifications:

  • Proven experience as a journalist, news analyst, or reporter in print, broadcast, or digital media environments.
  • Strong command of journalistic ethics, standards, and source validation methodologies.
  • Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with a keen attention to clarity, objectivity, and detail.
  • Experience narrating or writing news stories, reviews, or commentaries for various communications channels.
  • Ability to analyze information critically and provide actionable feedback.
  • Familiarity with AI, digital tools, or data-driven newsrooms is a plus.
  • Self-motivated, organized, and able to work independently in a virtual team setting.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience training or mentoring in newsroom environments or academic settings.
  • Prior work with AI or machine learning teams, especially related to language or media technologies.
  • Advanced degree in journalism, communications, or a related field.

title: Lead Industrial Product Designer [349]
descriptionText:
About the Company:Manta Sleep - was founded in 2016, and their team specializes in creating innovative sleep accessories designed to enhance sleep quality. Their flagship products include a variety of sleep masks and sleep accessories, all engineered to provide perfect sleep conditions for their users. The company is a strong advocate for the Pro-Nap Movement, promoting the benefits of regular napping and challenging traditional corporate norms that discourage rest during work hours. Their mission centers on empowering individuals to unlock their full potential through better sleep, offering products that cater to various sleep needs and preferences.
About the Role:We are looking to hire a mature and experienced Lead Industrial Product Designer who will be responsible for shaping the company’s product vision and leading the design team to create innovative sleep products that resonate with customers. You will work hands-on in a fast-growing e-commerce environment, balancing strategic planning with execution while managing a small but expanding team of designers and product managers.
The role requires a deep understanding of user needs, ensuring that each product launched not only meets high design standards but also drives business growth. Collaboration is key, as you will work closely with product design, marketing, and report directly to leadership to bring products to market successfully. With a global team spread across Europe and Asia, the candidate must be adaptable and capable of leading design efforts in a highly dynamic, entrepreneurial setting.
This is a Full-Time remote role.Salary Range: 70- 100k USD annually
We are looking for a Lead Industrial Product Designer specifically with these requirements:
Ideally, 5-10 years of experience in a Product Design role, having both hands-on and leadership experience.Previous experience in a smaller to mid-sized E-commerce business, with at least a $30M-$50M revenue.Experience designing soft products or similar (home or textile goods) is a must.Proven track record of building and managing small design teams.Ability to plan for product launches over the next 3+ years.Understanding of how to create products that customers love and that are feasible from the engineering side.Experience working closely with the product and marketing teams, and with external agencies when needed.Comfortable making decisions in a fast-paced environment with limited corporate infrastructure.Experience working with international teams across different time zones.Open to occasional travel, especially to Asia, for product development purposes.Strong communication and leadership skills, while being able to find a good balance between creative ideas and feasible solutions.

Your responsibility will include (but not limited to):
Develop and implement a long-term product design strategy aligned with business growth objectives.Be directly involved in design processes, from concept to launch, ensuring a balance of vision and execution.Oversee the design and launch of products that drive customer engagement and sales.Build, manage, and mentor a growing team of designers and product managers.Foster a hands-on, collaborative environment where creativity and efficiency thrive.Work closely with the product, marketing, and leadership team to bring products to market successfully.Ensure seamless coordination between design, production, engineering and marketing efforts.Iterate on product design based on user feedback, data, and market trends.Stay updated on design trends, customer preferences, and industry innovations.Use data-driven insights to enhance product design and user experience.Occasional travel to Asia - approx 3 times a year for product development and production coordination.
Growth Opportunities/Perks:
Freedom and control over your schedule.Open and transparent workplace.Freedom to be creative and own your work.No office politics or bureaucracyGreat growth opportunities and training resources.Unlimited vacation and sick leave days.
This Position Is Perfect For You If…
You're a visionary problem solver.You won’t be expected to have all the answers from day one, but you’ll need to think strategically, adapt quickly, and drive innovative product designs that align with business goals.
You're highly organized and hands-on.You can balance big-picture vision with hands-on execution, ensuring that design projects move forward smoothly while leading and growing a small, agile team.
You're passionate about creating products people love.You understand the intersection of design, functionality, and customer needs, ensuring that every product developed is not just well-designed but also highly desirable and marketable.

Our hiring process is made up of four parts, so please be aware that you will need to dedicate time for a questionnaire, a video, and two 1-on-1 interviews.Thank you for taking the time to consider this position. I look forward to hearing from you soon!

With a global team spread across Europe and Asia, the candidate must be adaptable and capable of leading design efforts in a highly dynamic, entrepreneurial setting.


This is a Full-Time remote role.

Salary Range: 70- 100k USD annually


We are looking for a Lead Industrial Product Designer specifically with these requirements:


  • Ideally, 5-10 years of experience in a Product Design role, having both hands-on and leadership experience.
  • Previous experience in a smaller to mid-sized E-commerce business, with at least a $30M-$50M revenue.
  • Experience designing soft products or similar (home or textile goods) is a must.
  • Proven track record of building and managing small design teams.
  • Ability to plan for product launches over the next 3+ years.
  • Understanding of how to create products that customers love and that are feasible from the engineering side.
  • Experience working closely with the product and marketing teams, and with external agencies when needed.
  • Comfortable making decisions in a fast-paced environment with limited corporate infrastructure.
  • Experience working with international teams across different time zones.
  • Open to occasional travel, especially to Asia, for product development purposes.
  • Strong communication and leadership skills, while being able to find a good balance between creative ideas and feasible solutions.


Your responsibility will include (but not limited to):


  • Develop and implement a long-term product design strategy aligned with business growth objectives.
  • Be directly involved in design processes, from concept to launch, ensuring a balance of vision and execution.
  • Oversee the design and launch of products that drive customer engagement and sales.
  • Build, manage, and mentor a growing team of designers and product managers.
  • Foster a hands-on, collaborative environment where creativity and efficiency thrive.
  • Work closely with the product, marketing, and leadership team to bring products to market successfully.
  • Ensure seamless coordination between design, production, engineering and marketing efforts.
  • Iterate on product design based on user feedback, data, and market trends.
  • Stay updated on design trends, customer preferences, and industry innovations.
  • Use data-driven insights to enhance product design and user experience.
  • Occasional travel to Asia - approx 3 times a year for product development and production coordination.

Growth Opportunities/Perks:


  • Freedom and control over your schedule.
  • Open and transparent workplace.
  • Freedom to be creative and own your work.
  • No office politics or bureaucracy
  • Great growth opportunities and training resources.
  • Unlimited vacation and sick leave days.

This Position Is Perfect For You If…


You're a visionary problem solver.

You won’t be expected to have all the answers from day one, but you’ll need to think strategically, adapt quickly, and drive innovative product designs that align with business goals.


You're highly organized and hands-on.

You can balance big-picture vision with hands-on execution, ensuring that design projects move forward smoothly while leading and growing a small, agile team.


You're passionate about creating products people love.

You understand the intersection of design, functionality, and customer needs, ensuring that every product developed is not just well-designed but also highly desirable and marketable.



Our hiring process is made up of four parts, so please be aware that you will need to dedicate time for a questionnaire, a video, and two 1-on-1 interviews.

Thank you for taking the time to consider this position. I look forward to hearing from you soon!

title: UX Designer - Spatial / ExD
descriptionText:
Description

Location: Europe-based (Remote)

Type: Freelance

Start Date: July 2025 (ASAP)

The Role

We’re looking for an XR UX Designer to support the rapid prototyping efforts of our Demo team, contributing to the development of our immersive sports platform. This role focuses on quickly translating ideas into functional spatial experiences by applying existing UX patterns and modules—bringing the product vision to life in headset.

You’ll work closely with the Creative Director, Tech Lead and the rest of the UX team to develop wireframes and flows, iterate based on feedback, and collaborate with developers to ensure accurate and timely implementation.

This is a hands-on role for someone who thrives in fast-paced environments, communicates clearly, and enjoys building within existing frameworks. You should be comfortable thinking creatively within constraints, and motivated by shaping the future of sports viewing in XR.

Requirements

What You’ll Do:

Design and document spatial interaction flows and layout logic for headset-based prototypesAssemble new screens and UX flows using an evolving library of modular componentsAdapt base content modules (e.g. game stats panels) for sport-specific usesCreate wireframes and mockups to inform developers and clientsWork closely with the Creative Director to translate abstract ideas into usable conceptsSupport the Tech Lead in aligning designs with platform constraintsCollaborate with developers to ensure intended user experience is implemented correctlyTest and refine designs on headset, based on stakeholder feedback

What You Will Bring

3+ years of UX design experience, with at least 1 year working in XR or immersive environmentsExperience designing for spatial or headset-based interfaces, including interaction with rectilinear and 180° videoFamiliarity with ergonomic and accessibility best practices in XRComfortable designing within modular systems, adapting and reusing established componentsStrong communication and collaboration skills with technical and creative team membersHands-on experience working with Figma to convey spatial UX logicA quick problem-solver with an eye for flow, usability, and spatial clarity

Bonus

Passion for sports and affinity with how fans engage during broadcasts

Benefits

Benefits

This is a Nexus-led role, embedded in a highly collaborative, partner-facing development environment. You’ll help shape the way fans experience sports in XR—from how they press play to how they control, explore, and feel part of the action.

If you're excited about building the future of fan engagement through smart, human-centered design—we’d love to talk.

Nexus Studios is proud to work with extraordinary talent as an equal opportunity employer. We embrace individuals of all backgrounds regardless of gender, race, age, abilities or sexual preferences. Our recruitment process is merit-based, ensuring fair treatment to every applicant.

Think: ZOE meets Peanut — personalised, clinical, and community-powered.We’re starting with a symptom-first quiz, medically tailored meals, and education-led content, evolving into a fully integrated health platform.

You’ll lead the design of our onboarding quiz, community features, and brand experience from the ground up.This is a founding team role with 5% equity and no salary until funding is secured.
What You’ll Be DesigningA symptom-first onboarding quiz that is warm, engaging, and personalisedA community-embedded experience (think story-sharing, habit tracking, emotional support)A branded visual identity that feels trustworthy, empowering, and content-forwardUser journeys that include meal prescription, progress dashboards, education modulesWeb-based MVP (mobile-responsive, not an app initially)
 What We're Looking ForMust-Have ExperienceDesigned or prototyped a quiz-style product (e.g. symptom checkers, nutrition profiling, onboarding journeys)Experience with community-led UX (forums, member stories, reactions, shared journeys, etc.)Strong visual/UI sensibility — you’ve created or evolved a brand system that feels consistent, warm, and mission-drivenWorked closely with content creators, marketers, or community teamsHands-on with Figma and prototyping toolsComfort working in early-stage, zero-to-one environments with imperfect information and tight feedback loops

descriptionHtml:
Founding UX/UI Designer (Equity Only – 5%)

Women’s Health • Brand-Led • Content-Driven • Community-First


About Healthy Fridge

Healthy Fridge is on a mission to reinvent women's health through food. We're building a tech-enabled nutrition platform that supports women managing hormonal and metabolic conditions like PCOS, menopause, and GLP-1 use (e.g. Ozempic). Think: ZOE meets Peanut — personalised, clinical, and community-powered.

We’re starting with a symptom-first quiz, medically tailored meals, and education-led content, evolving into a fully integrated health platform.


The Role

We're looking for a founding UX/UI designer to help bring Healthy Fridge to life — visually and experientially. You’ll lead the design of our onboarding quiz, community features, and brand experience from the ground up.

This is a founding team role with 5% equity and no salary until funding is secured.


What You’ll Be Designing
  • A symptom-first onboarding quiz that is warm, engaging, and personalised
  • A community-embedded experience (think story-sharing, habit tracking, emotional support)
  • A branded visual identity that feels trustworthy, empowering, and content-forward
  • User journeys that include meal prescription, progress dashboards, education modules
  • Web-based MVP (mobile-responsive, not an app initially)

What We're Looking ForMust-Have Experience
  • Designed or prototyped a quiz-style product (e.g. symptom checkers, nutrition profiling, onboarding journeys)
  • Experience with community-led UX (forums, member stories, reactions, shared journeys, etc.)
  • Strong visual/UI sensibility — you’ve created or evolved a brand system that feels consistent, warm, and mission-driven
  • Worked closely with content creators, marketers, or community teams
  • Hands-on with Figma and prototyping tools
  • Comfort working in early-stage, zero-to-one environments with imperfect information and tight feedback loops

Bonus Points
  • Healthtech, Femtech, or consumer wellness experience
  • Familiar with platforms like ZOE, Daye, Peanut, Flo, Elvie, Levels, or Allplants
  • Experience designing content-led or editorial products
  • Open to collaborating with a registered dietitian, medical advisors, and meal delivery partners

What We Offer
  • 5% equity in a mission-led, VC-backable women’s health platform
  • Co-founder level influence in product direction, brand tone, and platform roadmap
  • A values-driven team passionate about science-backed nutrition, inclusivity, and changing the experience of healthcare for women
  • Full transparency, collaborative decision-making, and freedom to shape your work

Logistics
  • Remote or UK-based preferred
  • Expected contribution: 8–10 hours/week to start, growing post-funding
  • Must be comfortable with equity-only until we raise

company.name: Healthy Fridge
company.description:
Healthy Fridge is a UK-based food-as-medicine startup delivering clinically designed, dietitian-approved meals for chronic health conditions — starting with PCOS.

We create fridge-ready, weekly meal plans that follow evidence-based nutrition guidelines and support people struggling with hormonal, metabolic, and gut-related health issues. Our meals are developed in partnership with HCPC-registered dietitians and delivered chilled, ready to heat, and tailored to real health goals.

title: Product Designer
descriptionText:
Chooose builds software to enable the lower carbon fuel value chains in hard-to-abate sectors.
Companies like Alaska Airlines, Air Canada, Delta Air Lines, and Flexport use the Chooose platform to build, operate and scale their SAF programs, and to advance voluntary and compliance carbon initiatives.
With offices in Oslo, Amsterdam and Miami, and remote employees across the US and Europe, we are a mission-oriented team that is scaling our business and climate impact in tandem. The company has raised $50M from leading venture capital and strategic investors.
In this role, you will help chart our course into the future as we evolve from a transactional product to a product suite that includes a heavy UX/UI SaaS offering. You will be critical to defining problems and building out climate tech solutions from 0 -> 1 for aviation, travel, and maritime companies. Working closely with a small team of designers and many stakeholders, we aspire for this new joiner to work through design problems from beginning to end covering UX research, information architecture, interaction design, and visual design.
What you'll doTake point on ensuring we offer an intuitive, supportive experience for our partners to manage their decarbonization effortsTranslate insights from research into concepts that form new products and features, design the detailed workflows and interactions required to make them a realityDefine the relationships between new or extended objects in our domain model and determine how that pertains to the user's experienceWork closely with engineering, product management, and cross-functional teams to define and execute the product strategyBounce between company objectives and the granular feature level minutiae that define a wonderful product
What you'll bring to the table5 + years of product design experienceA love for crafting high-quality, valuable solutions and getting them in front of customersA growth mindset and willingness to own ambiguous problemsA portfolio of product experiences that solved real problems, and that people useCapable at time boxing low fidelity explorations and getting feedback from stakeholdersWhen required, adept at high fidelity mock-ups and interactive Figma prototypesBonus points for experience in climatetech, fintech, or other highly regulated industriesA systems thinking mindset and an ability to work with complex domain modelsExperience in B2B enterprise software
The interview process
At Chooose, we prioritize transparency throughout our interview process. After reviewing your portfolio, if your qualifications look like a fit, we’ll begin with 1-2 introductory conversations where you'll have the chance to discuss your experience and learn more about our company. The second phase is two back-to-back sessions. In the first session you'll present a portfolio review for a small panel of 2-4 team members. Following your portfolio review, session two is a one-on-one chat with another team member. The third and final phase consists of a one-on-one conversation with a member of our executive team. The process should take approx. ~4 weeks. While we strive to keep to this timeline, the occasional adjustment may occur; we’re focused on ensuring for enough time to get to know one another.
**Applications must include a portfolio (and any necessary password) to be considered**
Pay, perks, & more
We offer a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits package, the option to participate in our employee equity program, flexible work hours, and a modern co-working office located in central Oslo, Norway. Come join a fun and supportive team dedicated to advancing climate solutions and tackling significant challenges.
We value diversity and believe forming teams in which everyone can be their authentic self is key to our success. We encourage people from underrepresented backgrounds and different industries to apply.
Compensation will be based on experience and skill, commensurate with market rates, and will include both salary and equity in Chooose.
Chooose is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate based on race, color, religion (creed), gender, gender expression, age, national origin (ancestry), disability, marital status, sexual orientation, or military status. We are committed to providing an inclusive and welcoming environment to our employees and welcome input from candidates and employees on how we can enhance our inclusiveness.
Prerequisite for Employment: Chooose may request to conduct background checks on prospective applicants to verify the information provided in the CV, transcripts, and other documentation. This background check may be carried out by our partner and will not be conducted without the applicant's prior consent. Prospective applicants will receive more information about this
descriptionHtml:
Chooose builds software to enable the lower carbon fuel value chains in hard-to-abate sectors.


Companies like Alaska Airlines, Air Canada, Delta Air Lines, and Flexport use the Chooose platform to build, operate and scale their SAF programs, and to advance voluntary and compliance carbon initiatives.


With offices in Oslo, Amsterdam and Miami, and remote employees across the US and Europe, we are a mission-oriented team that is scaling our business and climate impact in tandem. The company has raised $50M from leading venture capital and strategic investors.


In this role, you will help chart our course into the future as we evolve from a transactional product to a product suite that includes a heavy UX/UI SaaS offering. You will be critical to defining problems and building out climate tech solutions from 0 -> 1 for aviation, travel, and maritime companies. Working closely with a small team of designers and many stakeholders, we aspire for this new joiner to work through design problems from beginning to end covering UX research, information architecture, interaction design, and visual design.


What you'll do

  • Take point on ensuring we offer an intuitive, supportive experience for our partners to manage their decarbonization efforts
  • Translate insights from research into concepts that form new products and features, design the detailed workflows and interactions required to make them a reality
  • Define the relationships between new or extended objects in our domain model and determine how that pertains to the user's experience
  • Work closely with engineering, product management, and cross-functional teams to define and execute the product strategy
  • Bounce between company objectives and the granular feature level minutiae that define a wonderful product

What you'll bring to the table

  • 5 + years of product design experience
  • A love for crafting high-quality, valuable solutions and getting them in front of customers
  • A growth mindset and willingness to own ambiguous problems
  • A portfolio of product experiences that solved real problems, and that people use
  • Capable at time boxing low fidelity explorations and getting feedback from stakeholders
  • When required, adept at high fidelity mock-ups and interactive Figma prototypes
  • Bonus points for experience in climatetech, fintech, or other highly regulated industries
  • A systems thinking mindset and an ability to work with complex domain models
  • Experience in B2B enterprise software

The interview process


At Chooose, we prioritize transparency throughout our interview process. After reviewing your portfolio, if your qualifications look like a fit, we’ll begin with 1-2 introductory conversations where you'll have the chance to discuss your experience and learn more about our company. The second phase is two back-to-back sessions. In the first session you'll present a portfolio review for a small panel of 2-4 team members. Following your portfolio review, session two is a one-on-one chat with another team member. The third and final phase consists of a one-on-one conversation with a member of our executive team. The process should take approx. ~4 weeks. While we strive to keep to this timeline, the occasional adjustment may occur; we’re focused on ensuring for enough time to get to know one another.


**Applications must include a portfolio (and any necessary password) to be considered**


Pay, perks, & more


We offer a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits package, the option to participate in our employee equity program, flexible work hours, and a modern co-working office located in central Oslo, Norway. Come join a fun and supportive team dedicated to advancing climate solutions and tackling significant challenges.


We value diversity and believe forming teams in which everyone can be their authentic self is key to our success. We encourage people from underrepresented backgrounds and different industries to apply.


Compensation will be based on experience and skill, commensurate with market rates, and will include both salary and equity in Chooose.


Chooose is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate based on race, color, religion (creed), gender, gender expression, age, national origin (ancestry), disability, marital status, sexual orientation, or military status. We are committed to providing an inclusive and welcoming environment to our employees and welcome input from candidates and employees on how we can enhance our inclusiveness.


Prerequisite for Employment: Chooose may request to conduct background checks on prospective applicants to verify the information provided in the CV, transcripts, and other documentation. This background check may be carried out by our partner and will not be conducted without the applicant's prior consent. Prospective applicants will receive more information about this
